cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4-27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: No heatwave is happening right now.  There have been 6 such events this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: The storm today is ranked 8th for the amount of rainfall recorded during one storm.  13.04mm fell at a maximum rate of 8.6mm per hour over 7.9 hours.  27.64mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 15.9 hour precipitation event.  At times precipitation was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A rapid deluge happened today when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour (ranked top in our records).  The storm lasted 2.0 hours and 7.99mm of precipitation fell during that time.

storm.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 23.2 hours on 23 November 2024 when 24.56mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 6.4mm per hour.
Active storm detected in the vicinity.  The last storm we experienced was on 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: Currently experiencing a significant rainy period, ranked 5th longest since August 2024.  So far, it has lasted 9 consecutive days beginning 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (201°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 73.44 miles.

speed.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.8°C) and outside temperature (up 3.0°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 1.8 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1547 m), light levels (up 3071 lux), and inside temperature (up 2.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 45.1m higher than yesterday, 437.8m lower than the past week, 1546.7m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 713m and a high of 1594m, averaging 1112.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; like a nice, warm day. Also, the air will be thick and uncomfortable and calm and still conditions are expected. Moderate rainfall, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and some sunny spells will occur. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
